intro: Anthospermum uwembae, commonly known as the Uwemba sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically succulent, adapted to arid environments, and its roots are fibrous. Anthospermum uwembae is often found in sandy or rocky soils, thriving in well-drained conditions.
